result.execSummary:
The defendant Danny F Emmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.02(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

Defendant's pro se motion to modify sentence.
on Petition for Determination of Eligibility for the Substance Abuse Program - Request is DENIED; signed and filed.
Defendant's request for eligibility for substance abuse program.
Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING (28 pages) commencing SEPTEMBER 11, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Danny F Emmer in court with attorney Basil Martin Loeb.  Defendant Danny F Emmer in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Sentencing proceeds. PSI reviewed.  No additions or changes made to the PSI.  Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence the defendant is currently serving.  
INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS.  Credit for ZERO days time served.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victim, Mark P.
* Cooperate and participate with mental health evaluation and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Cooperate and participate with any programming the Probation Department deems appropriate.
* Provide a DNA sample (unless previously done) and PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered that the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered that the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY restitution in the amount of $4,060.00 payable to Society Insurance.  The Court ordered that restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is to convert to a civil judgment.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

(DEFENDANT REMANDED INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)

Atty. Basil Loeb appeared TELEPHONICALLY.  Defendant does not appear; is currently in custody and not produced.  ADA Joanne Hardtke appeared in court.

Defendant was moved to Fox Lake Correctional and was not produced for tomorrow's hearing.  Clerk rescheduled th 08-20-2014 at 8:30 AM Sentencing Hearing to 09-11-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.
Sentencing hearing on August 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Clerk received an email from the Probation Department advising the Court that the defendant is still in central intake at Dodge Correctional and is unable to receive paperwork to arrange a phone conference with the PSI writer.  Probation Department requests that the 07-17-2014 at 8:30 AM Sentencing Hearing date be rescheduled to a date after 08-07-2014.  Case rescheduled to 08-20-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Sentencing Hearing.  Notices mailed on this date.
for Presentence Investigation Report; signed and filed.  Copy forwarded to the Probation Department for processing.
as to victim, Mark P., filed by ADA Joanne Hardtke on behalf of the State.

Defendant Danny F Emmer in court with attorney Basil M Loeb.  Defendant Danny F Emmer in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form tendered to the Court.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY "as charged". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Upon State's request, Court ordered a Presentence Investigation Report (PSI).

  (DEFENDANT REMANDED WITHOUT BAIL INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)

Case adjourned to 07-17-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

for Substitution of Counsel; signed and filed.  Atty. Basil Loeb is now the attorney of record in place of Atty. Richard Carpenter.
